intro: Pseudodicliptera humilis, commonly known as the low-growing dicliptera, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. The plant features slender, creeping stems with small, opposite leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are often white or pale yellow in color. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
